title: Rebekah Vardy needs to ‘rebuild trust’ after Coleen Rooney scandal
text:
Coleen’s allegations shocked the nation (Picture: Getty; Rex)

Rebekah Vardy will have to ‘rebuild trust’ within her a-list celebrity circles following the Coleen Rooney scandal, according to a PR expert.

The 37-year-old, who is married to Leicester City footballer Jamie Vardy, has been in a media storm after Coleen accused her account of being the source of false stories about Coleen being leaked to the press.

While Rebekah has vehemently denied being the source of the allegations, herself saying that others have used her account without her knowing, there’s no doubt her public image has taken a hit as a result.

Weighing in on the controversy, celebrity PR guru Ed Hopkins told Metro.co.uk: ‘I think Rebeka Vardy is in an extremely difficult position and has a lot of work to do from recovering from the social scandal.

‘I personally think that as her social circle is with high profile celebrities and trust is crucial to maintaining friendships with footballers and a-list celebrities.’

On Wednesday, Coleen shocked her social media followers when she posted a lengthy message detailing how she set up a sting to determine which of her Instagram followers had been selling stories about her to the newspapers.

Coleen, wife of DC United footballer Wayne Rooney, claims Rebekah’s Instagram account was the only one able to view the false stories she had planted.

Rebekah has denied the allegations (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Coleen came up with quite an elaborate sting (Picture: Getty Images)

Strongly protesting her innocence, Rebekah has hired lawyers to carry out an investigation into her Instagram account, suggesting others had access to her page.

The situation only escalated when fellow WAG Danielle Lloyd sided with Coleen and got into a Twitter spat with Rebekah.

Hopkins said of the epic fallout: ‘The fact [Rebekah] is now having public arguments with Danielle Lloyd is completely the wrong thing to do and making her look even worse.’

The PR guru believes Rebekah’s next step should be to take time out of the spotlight and allow the investigation to take place quietly.

Caption: Coleen Rooney Rebekah Vardy social media reaction

‘I think she should refuse to comment in the media and deal with this personally with Coleen,’ Hopkins advises.

‘She is now making things worse by… explaining her side of the story and as we all know, comments to the media can get twisted and explode the situation up more than it already has been.’

Rebekah has already spoken out on the allegations in an interview with the Mail Online.

Recalling her phone conversation with Coleen, the mum-of-four said: ‘I said to her: “Coleen, what on earth have you done?”

‘It was not an easy phone call. She said to me: “I’m not pointing the finger” and I said: “You have just annihilated me in public and hung me out to dry. The whole world hates me!”

‘I thought she was my friend but she completely annihilated me. She said: “You know, I always really liked you, which makes it harder.”’
